<title level="1" right="Spell 3" pfs="Standard">[Oneiric Mire](/Spells.aspx?ID=961)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Illusion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=92" />
<trait label="Mental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=106" />
<trait label="Visual" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=163" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 119 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

<row gap="tiny">
<row>**Cast**</row>
<row><actions string="Three Actions" /></row>
<row>[somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)</row>
</row>

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 120 feet

**Area** 20-foot burst

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You shroud an area in illusory dreamstuff, making the ground look and feel like a deep mire or quicksand. Ground in the area is difficult terrain.

 Each creature in the area when the spell is cast, or that enters the area, must attempt a Will save. On a failure, it believes it's being pulled down by the earth, taking a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds. On a critical failure, it's also [immobilized](/Conditions.aspx?ID=24). In addition to the normal actions to [Escape](/Actions.aspx?ID=79), at the end of an affected creature's turn, it can attempt a Will save, removing the effects on a success. On a critical success at any Will save made against _oneiric mire_, the creature fully [disbelieves](/Rules.aspx?ID=267) the illusion and no longer needs to make Will saves to risk a Speed penalty or being immobilized, though the area is still difficult terrain.
name: Oneiric Mire
